title: Alabama’s attack on DEI hinders STEM teaching | Science
content: Plans to dismantle structures that support diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) are in motion across higher education in the United States. In March, Alabama passed Senate Bill 129, which prohibits educators from “compelling [students to] assent” to “divisive concepts” in higher education (1). This bill will negatively affect faculty and students, especially those from marginalized groups.
